title: Practice with Random Variables
body: Suppose you play a game with a biased coin. You play each game by tossing the coin once. $$P(heads)=\frac{2}{3}$$ and $$P(tails)=\frac{1}{3}$$. If you toss a head, you pay $6. If you toss a tail, you win $10. We want to determine whether we'll come out ahead (gain a profit).
lesson: Review: Statistics - Mean and Standard Deviation
